intro: Homoianthus cubataensis, commonly known as the Cuban starflower, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
